page.title: 15HOMES CONT.
page.content: {DRAYTON PARSLOW.}HERE THIRTY FIVE PEOPLE WERE INTERVIEWED.FOURTEEN PEOPLE HAVED LIVED HERE FOR LESS THAN FIVE YEARS AND SEVEN HAVE LIVED FOR LESS THAN ONE YEAR.ONLY FIVE PEOPLE LIVED HERE ALL THEIR LIVES.DOGS WERE AGAIN THE HIGHEST(SIXTEEN),CATS (FOURTEEN),FISH WERE QUITE HIGH(FIVE). AGAIN THERE IS NO GAS SO FOOD IS COOKED BY ELECTRICITY.MOST PEOPLE USED THE VILLAGE SHOPS. IN BOTH VILLAGES CARS WERE OWNDED BY THE MAJORITY OF HOUSEHOLDS.TWO OR THREE BEING QUITE COMMON.THIS IS PROBABLY DUE TO THE POOR BUS SERVICE AND THE NEAREST TRAIN STATIONS BEING MILTON KEYNES AND BLETCHLEY. ALL HOUSES ARE CONNECTED TO MAINS WATER AND EXCEPT FOR SOME OUTLYING FARMS MAINS SEWERAGE.
